item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Saturday, March 22, 2025 at 11:15 PM UTC
item.description:
1. The polar vortex is hitting the brakes (132 points | 75 comments)
2. NixOS and reproducible builds could have detected the xz backdoor (86 points | 28 comments)
3. Map Features in OpenStreetMap with Computer Vision (153 points | 34 comments)
4. Next.js version 15.2.3 has been released to address a security vulnerability (41 points | 19 comments)
5. PyTorch Internals: Ezyang's Blog (242 points | 17 comments)
6. Mathematical Methods for Physics [pdf] (44 points | 17 comments)
7. Tencent's 'Hunyuan-T1'–The First Mamba-Powered Ultra-Large Model (111 points | 50 comments)
8. Quitting an Intel x86 Hypervisor (22 points | 1 comment)
9. The Vectrex Computer (3 points | discuss)
10. Leaping AI (YC W25) Is Hiring ( | hide)
11. Magical Instant Bullets (15 points | 2 comments)
12. Landrun: Sandbox any Linux process using Landlock, no root or containers (214 points | 67 comments)
13. Trapping misbehaving bots in an AI Labyrinth (76 points | 31 comments)
14. Paul A. M. Dirac, Interview by Friedrich Hund (1982) [video] (71 points | 15 comments)
15. Show HN: FastOpenAPI – automated docs for many Python frameworks (98 points | 49 comments)
16. California Attorney General issues consumer alert for 23andMe customers (226 points | 170 comments)

18. Bra and KET: String Interpolation in AmigaDOS (38 points | 1 comment)
19. Optimizing Brainfuck interpreter in the C preprocessor (4 points | discuss)
20. Understanding R1-Zero-Like Training: A Critical Perspective (90 points | 11 comments)
21. Monster Cables picked the wrong guy to threaten (2008) (504 points | 169 comments)
22. Derivatives and Logarithms of 3D Transforms (16 points | discuss)
23. CEO of Kubient sentenced for fraud (128 points | 40 comments)
24. Most AI value will come from broad automation, not from R&D (69 points | 72 comments)
25. Crabtime: Zig’s Comptime in Rust (380 points | 133 comments)
26. Show HN: We made an MCP server so Cursor can debug Node.js on its own (39 points | 10 comments)
27. “Vibe Coding” vs. Reality (157 points | 169 comments)
28. Italy demands Google poison DNS under strict Piracy Shield law (84 points | 57 comments)
29. Hubble Captures Vivid Auroras in Jupiter's Atmosphere (2016) (35 points | 7 comments)
30. Scallop – A Language for Neurosymbolic Programming (180 points | 47 comments)
